abstract: The British bank’s pretax profit rose 26 percent, to $6.8 billion, as growth in its Asian and Latin American banking businesses more than made up for a slump in its European operations.
snippet: The British bank’s pretax profit rose 26 percent, to $6.8 billion, as growth in its Asian and Latin American banking businesses more than made up for a slump in its European operations.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — HSBC said on Tuesday that earnings rose 26 percent in the first three months of the year, as growth in its Asian and Latin American banking businesses more than made up for a slump in Europe.

headline.main: HSBC Profit Rises 26% in First Quarter
